pullRequest.body:
We prove analytic continuation of the L-function of any periodic function on the naturals, including Dirichlet characters.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [a7331767e8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13997/commits/a7331767e87322db87aca53ee3946e71ad7843db)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.ZMod`|2164|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.DirichletContinuation`|2165|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LFunction_dft`
`+ LFunction_one_sub`
`+ LFunction_residue_one`
`+ LFunction_stdAddChar_eq_expZeta`
`+ LSeriesSummable_of_one_lt_re`
`+ Nat.residueClassesEquiv`
`+ Nat.sumByResidueClasses`
`+ differentiable_LFunction`
`+ differentiable_LFunction_of_sum_zero`
`+ term_of_ne_zero'`
`++ LFunction`
`++ LFunction_eq_LSeries`
`++ LFunction_modOne_eq`
`++ differentiableAt_LFunction`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks Ruben and Johan for all the comments! Ready for review again.
Well spotted, thanks Ruben! Are we done here, then?

> Excellent work David! Thanks a lot!

+1 (and sorry for not finding the time to review...)
Thanks for all the feedback, everyone! Is anyone willing to take the leap and submit this for merging?

OK, I'll bite!
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.
Bors merge
bors merge
Already running a review

Build failed:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10653091680/job/29527795583)

bors r-
Can you merge master, fix the lint, and then send it back to bors?
bors d+

:v: loefflerd can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Aargh – it seems that in the interval of ~4 days since I last merged master, some other PR's got merged which added a few lines to `Mathlib.Data.ZMod.Basic`, and those changes together with the ones in this PR put it just over the length limit. Will fix.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10654556734/job/29531014983)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10654556734/job/29531014910)

I'm not sure I agree with the L-in-names argument, but I see we'd need to change it more widely than this change, so no need to block on it.

Just one more comment from my side
Excellent work David! Thanks a lot!

I'm not sure I agree with the L-in-names argument, but I see we'd need to change it more widely than this change, so no need to block on it.

Just one more comment from my side
Excellent work David! Thanks a lot!
Could you please consider writing this as a `calc`-mode proof? I think it would improve readability, and probably also maintainability of the proof.
Should this be a simp lemma?

Minor suggestion:
```suggestion
  have hU {u} : u ∈ U ↔ u ≠ 1 ∨ j ≠ 0 := by simp only [Set.mem_ite_univ_right, U]; tauto
  -- hypotheses for uniqueness of analytic continuation
  have hf : AnalyticOn ℂ f U := by
    refine DifferentiableOn.analyticOn (fun u hu ↦ ?_) hUo
    refine (differentiableAt_LFunction _ _ ((hU.mp hu).imp_right fun h ↦ ?_)).differentiableWithinAt
    simp only [mul_comm j, AddChar.sum_mulShift _ (isPrimitive_stdAddChar _), h,
        ↓reduceIte, CharP.cast_eq_zero, or_true]
  have hg : AnalyticOn ℂ g U := by
    refine DifferentiableOn.analyticOn (fun u hu ↦ ?_) hUo
    refine (differentiableAt_expZeta _ _ ((hU.mp hu).imp_right fun h ↦ ?_)).differentiableWithinAt
    rwa [ne_eq, toAddCircle_eq_zero]
  have hUc : IsPreconnected U := by
    by_cases h : j = 0
    · simpa only [h, ↓reduceIte, U] using
        (isConnected_compl_singleton_of_one_lt_rank (by simp) _).isPreconnected
    · simpa only [h, ↓reduceIte, U] using isPreconnected_univ
  have hV : V ∈ 𝓝 2 := (continuous_re.isOpen_preimage _ isOpen_Ioi).mem_nhds (by simp)
  have hUmem : 2 ∈ U := by simp [U]
  have hUmem' : s ∈ U := hU.mpr hjs.symm
```
This seems like a purely algebraic result; can it go somewhere earlier?
Good point, I moved it to `Data.ZMod.Basic`.
The assumption in the lemma is `s ≠ 0`, not `0 < re s`
Should we not be using `lfunction` in lemma names by the naming convention? (Or namespacing)

This is a counterpart of the existing `DirichletCharacter.LSeries_modOne_eq`, which is an established exception to the naming conventions since the "L" in L-functions / L-series is always capitalized. (I renamed it slightly for consistency with that.)
Why do you need the `change`? Please try to avoid it

I would avoid relying on the `Set.Icc` definition, maybe with:
```suggestion
  have ha : (j.val / N : ℝ) ∈ Set.Icc 0 1 := by
    rw [Set.mem_Icc]
    constructor
    · positivity
    · rw [div_le_one (Nat.cast_pos.mpr <| NeZero.pos _), Nat.cast_le]
      exact (val_lt _).le
```

```suggestion
  Differentiable.const_cpow (by fun_prop) (Or.inl <| NeZero.ne _)
```
`Npow` doesn't seem in line with the naming convention either, though I guess you get a little more leeway with private lemmas
It only gets used twice anyway so I inlined it
I'm guessing this example shouldn't be here.
Oops! Yes, that was just me using `exact?` to find a simp lemma. Fixed now.

```suggestion
  rw [← this, Int.cast_mul, Int.cast_natCast, Int.cast_natCast, natCast_zmod_val]

```

(Off-topic: GitHub's web interface seems to have a bug. Your suggestion was to remove an unnecessary extra blank line, but the web page displays it as if you wanted to _add_ a blank line. Fortunately what actually got committed is the right thing, it is just the preview of the suggested change that is bogus.)

```suggestion
    LFunction χ = riemannZeta := by
  ext1; rw [LFunction, ZMod.LFunction_modOne_eq, (by rfl : (0 : ZMod 1) = 1), map_one, one_mul]
```

```suggestion
      ↓reduceIte, CharP.cast_eq_zero, or_true]
```

```suggestion
L-series of `χ` has analytic continuation (away from a pole at `s = 1` if `χ` is trivial).
```
And then another PR (#15610) landed, which means you should not add to `style-exceptions.txt` anymore. Instead add `set_option linter.style.longFile 1700` to the bottom of `Data.ZMod.Basic`.

> which means you should not add to style-exceptions.txt anymore. 

The linting script said, "run `lake exe lint-style --update` to fix this warning". So I did. Sounds like the code for `lint-style --update` needs updating...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): analytic continuation of Dirichlet L-series
